CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Compared with the reported copolymer PzNDTTPD , 14 both PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO show broader absorption spectra and smaller bandgaps , which can be attributed to the stronger electron - accepting ability of the BT / BO unit in the copolymer , and this is beneficial to increase the light - harvesting capacity for higher short - circuit current density ( J sc ).

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| copolymer PzNDTTPD |
| PzNDTDTBT |
| PzNDTDTBO |

These are the material names mentioned in the paragraph.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| copolymer PzNDTTPD |
| PzNDTDTBT |
| PzNDTDTBO |

These are the material names explicitly mentioned in the paragraph. Other entities such as "reported", "absorption spectra", "bandgaps", "electron - accepting ability", "BT / BO unit", "light - harvesting capacity", and "higher short - circuit current density" do not refer to specific materials and are not considered material names.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Compared with the reported copolymer PzNDTTPD , 14 both PzNDTDTBT and PzNDTDTBO show broader absorption spectra and smaller bandgaps , which can be attributed to the stronger electron - accepting ability of the BT / BO unit in the copolymer , and this is beneficial to increase the light - harvesting capacity for higher short - circuit current density ( J sc ).

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value            |
|-------------------------|
| broader absorption spectra |
| smaller bandgaps         |
| stronger electron - accepting ability of the BT / BO unit |
| beneficial to increase the light - harvesting capacity |
| higher short - circuit current density (J sc) |

The entities identified in the paragraph are:

1. broader absorption spectra
2. smaller bandgaps
3. stronger electron - accepting ability of the BT / BO unit
4. beneficial to increase the light - harvesting capacity
5. higher short - circuit current density (J sc)

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value            |
|-------------------------|
| broader absorption spectra |
| smaller bandgaps         |
| higher short - circuit current density (J sc) |

The entities identified in the paragraph that clearly refer to the value of material properties are:

1. broader absorption spectra
2. smaller bandgaps
3. higher short - circuit current density (J sc)

The entity "beneficial to increase the light - harvesting capacity" does not clearly refer to a material property value, but rather to the effect of the material properties on a certain performance metric.
